sections.doc_:
## Introduction

The [`amp-inputmask`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-inputmask.md) component enables input masks for form fields in AMP documents. Input masks automatically add formatting characters to user input, and prevent users from typing input that doesn't match the mask. For example, an input mask on a telephone field automatically adds special characters like `(`, `)` and `-`, and users can type only the numbers needed while the mask prevents them from typing incorrect characters.
sections.cachedMarkedDoc:
Introduction

The amp-inputmask component enables input masks for form fields in AMP documents. Input masks automatically add formatting characters to user input, and prevent users from typing input that doesn't match the mask. For example, an input mask on a telephone field automatically adds special characters like (, ) and -, and users can type only the numbers needed while the mask prevents them from typing incorrect characters.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
## Introduction

The [`amp-inputmask`](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-inputmask.md) component enables input masks for form fields in AMP documents. Input masks automatically add formatting characters to user input, and prevent users from typing input that doesn't match the mask. For example, an input mask on a telephone field automatically adds special characters like `(`, `)` and `-`, and users can type only the numbers needed while the mask prevents them from typing incorrect characters.

sections.doc_: Import the amp-inputmask component in the header
sections.normalizedDoc_: Import the amp-inputmask component in the header

sections.doc_:
`amp-inputmask` depends on the `amp-form` extension,
so the `amp-form` script also needs to be added to the document.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
`amp-inputmask` depends on the `amp-form` extension,
so the `amp-form` script also needs to be added to the document.

sections.doc_:
`amp-mustache` isn't required to use `amp-inputmask`, but here `amp-form`
uses it to render the `submit-success` message.
sections.normalizedDoc_:
`amp-mustache` isn't required to use `amp-inputmask`, but here `amp-form`
uses it to render the `submit-success` message.

<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,minimum-scale=1,initial-scale=1">
<style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-moz-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;-ms-animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both;animation:-amp-start 8s steps(1,end) 0s 1 normal both}@-webkit-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-moz-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-ms-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@-o-keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}@keyframes -amp-start{from{visibility:hidden}to{visibility:visible}}</style><noscript><style amp-boilerplate>body{-webkit-animation:none;-moz-animation:none;-ms-animation:none;animation:none}</style></noscript>
</head>
<body>

sections.doc_:
The `mask` attribute specifies the characters that users are allowed to input, and any special characters that can be automatically added by the mask. Here, the user may enter a Canadian postal code.

In the mask, `L` allows the user to enter an alphabetic character. `0` denotes a numeric character. `_` is a literal space character. See the full mask specification at [the `amp-inputmask` documentation](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-inputmask.md)
sections.normalizedDoc_:
The `mask` attribute specifies the characters that users are allowed to input, and any special characters that can be automatically added by the mask. Here, the user may enter a Canadian postal code.

In the mask, `L` allows the user to enter an alphabetic character. `0` denotes a numeric character. `_` is a literal space character. See the full mask specification at [the `amp-inputmask` documentation](/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-inputmask.md)

sections.doc_: If the `mask-output` attribute is set to `"alphanumeric"`, `amp-inputmask` will add a hidden input with only the alphanumeric characters from the original input. The default value is `"raw"`
sections.normalizedDoc_: If the `mask-output` attribute is set to `"alphanumeric"`, `amp-inputmask` will add a hidden input with only the alphanumeric characters from the original input. The default value is `"raw"`
